SEARCH
Module java.base
Package java.lang.template

Class PolicyBuilder

java.lang.Object
java.lang.template.PolicyBuilder
public class PolicyBuilder extends Object
PolicyBuilder is a preview API of the Java platform.
Programs can only use PolicyBuilder when preview features are enabled.
Preview features may be removed in a future release, or upgraded to permanent features of the Java platform.
This builder class can be used to simplify the construction of a StringPolicyPREVIEW or SimplePolicyPREVIEW.

The user starts by creating a new instance of this class using TemplatePolicy.builder()PREVIEW. When the user is finished composing the policy then they should invoke build() on the instance returning a new instance of StringPolicyPREVIEW.

The fragment(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>) and value(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object>) methods can be used to validate and map the TemplatedString'sPREVIEW fragments and values.

Most instance methods in PolicyBuilderPREVIEW return this PolicyBuilderPREVIEW, so it is possible to chain the methods. Example: 

     StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .fragment(f -> f.toUpperCase())
         .value(v -> v instanceof Integer i ? Math.abs(i) : v)
         .build();
The preliminary method allows the policy to validate and map the source TemplatedStringPREVIEW.

The format(java.lang.String, java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object, java.lang.String>) method allows the policy to format values. The marker specifies the string of characters marking the beginning of a format specifier. The specifier is then passed to a BiFunction along with the value to format. Example: 

     StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .format("%", (specifier, value) ->
                 justify(String.valueOf(value), Integer.parseInt(specifier)))
         .build();
     int x = 10;
     int y = 12345;
     String result = policy.apply("%4\{x} + %4\{y} = %-5\{x + y}");
Output: " 10 + **** = 12355"

The resolve() method adds a value map that resolves Supplier, Future and FutureTask values before passing resolve values on to the next value map.

The alternate form of build(Function) allows the user to transform the PolicyBuilderPREVIEW result to something other than a (@link String}. Example: 

     SimplePolicy<JSONObject> policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .build(s -> new JSONObject(s));
Implementation Note:
Due to the nature of lambdas, validating functions can only throw unchecked exceptions, ex. RuntimeException.
Since:
20

  • Method Details

    • clear

      public PolicyBuilderPREVIEW clear()
      Resets the builder to the initial state.
      Returns:
      this Builder

    • preliminary

      public PolicyBuilderPREVIEW preliminary(Function<TemplatedStringPREVIEW,TemplatedStringPREVIEW> preliminary)
      Augment the function that is used to validate and map the source TemplatedStringPREVIEW. Each successive call adds to the mapping, chaining the result from the previous function. The initial function is the identity function. Example: 
          StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .preliminary(ts -> {
              List<String> fragments = ts.fragments().map(s -> s.toUpperCase()).toList();
              List<Object> values = ts.values();
              return TemplatedString.of(fragments, values);
         })
         .build();
      Parameters:
      preliminary - Function used to validate and map the source TemplatedStringPREVIEW.
      Returns:
      this PolicyBuilderPREVIEW instance

    • fragment

      public PolicyBuilderPREVIEW fragment(Function<String,String> mapFragment)
      Augment the function that is used to validate and map TemplatedStringPREVIEW fragments. Each successive call adds to the mapping, chaining the result from the previous function. The initial function is the identity function. Example: 
          StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .fragment(f -> f.toUpperCase())
         .build();
      Parameters:
      mapFragment - Function used to validate and map the fragment
      Returns:
      this PolicyBuilderPREVIEW instance

    • value

      public PolicyBuilderPREVIEW value(Function<Object,Object> mapValue)
      Augment the function that is used to validate and map TemplatedStringPREVIEW values. Each successive call adds to the mapping, chaining the result from the previous function. The initial function is the identity function. Example: 
          StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .value(v -> v instanceof Integer i ? Math.abs(i) : v)
         .build();
      Parameters:
      mapValue - Function used to validate and map the fragment
      Returns:
      this PolicyBuilderPREVIEW instance

    • resolve

      public PolicyBuilderPREVIEW resolve()
      Augment the function that is used to validate and map TemplatedStringPREVIEW values by adding a function that resolves Supplier, Future and FutureTask values before passing on to next map value function. Example: 
          StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .resolve()
         .build();
      Implementation Note:
      The resolving function will throw a RuntimeException if a (@link Future} throws during resolution.
      Returns:
      this PolicyBuilderPREVIEW instance

    • format

      public PolicyBuilderPREVIEW format(String marker, BiFunction<String,Object,String> formatValue)
      Add a final formatting step before a value is added to the policy result. The marker string is used to locate any format specifier in the fragment prior to the value. The specifier is removed from the fragment and passed to the formatValue binary function along with the value. The marker is not included in the specifier. Example: 
           StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .format("%", (specifier, value) ->
                 justify(String.valueOf(value), Integer.parseInt(specifier)))
         .build();
      Parameters:
      marker - String used to mark the beginning of a format specifier or "" to indicate no format processing.
      formatValue - BiFunction used to format the value
      Returns:
      this PolicyBuilderPREVIEW instance

    • build

      public StringPolicyPREVIEW build()
      Construct a new StringPolicyPREVIEW using elements added to the builder. The policy will initially run the preliminary map function on the source TemplatedStringPREVIEW. The policy will then iterate through fragments and values, applying the fragment map function and value map function on each iteration. If a format function is supplied, the value will be formatted before adding to the result. The result of the policy will be a string composed the mapped fragments and values. Example: 
           StringPolicy policy = TemplatePolicy.builder()
         .build();
      Returns:
      a new StringPolicyPREVIEW instance

    • build

      public <R> SimplePolicyPREVIEW<R> build(Function<String,R> transform)
      This version of build performs the same actions as build() but always for a final transformation step to convert the string result to a non-string result. Example:
      Type Parameters:
      R - type of result
      Parameters:
      transform - Function used to map the string result to a non-string result.
      Returns:
      a new SimplePolicyPREVIEW instance
